questions.reportingCategory: Number Sense and Operations with Whole Numbers
questions.text: Using the plot on the number line, which letter represents the number 250,000?
questions.explanation: First, determine the scale of the number line by checking how much value changes between each tick mark. Once you know the interval (e.g., does each mark represent 10,000 or 50,000?), count up from the start to find 250,000.

Compare the value of Group A (hundreds) to Group B (tens). Consider how many times you would need to multiply 20 to get 200, or think about the place value shift from the tens place to the hundreds place.
options: Group A is 100 times the value of Group B.
Group B is 10 times the value of Group A.
Group A is 10 times the value of Group B.
Group B is 1/100 the value of Group A.
questions.text: Look at the base-ten blocks in the image. Group A represents 200. Group B represents 20. Which statement is true?
questions.reportingCategory: Number Sense and Operations with Whole Numbers

questions.explanation: Compare the value of Group A (hundreds) to Group B (tens). Consider how many times you would need to multiply 20 to get 200, or think about the place value shift from the tens place to the hundreds place.
options: Group A is 100 times the value of Group B.
Group B is 10 times the value of Group A.
Group A is 10 times the value of Group B.
Group B is 1/100 the value of Group A.
questions.text: Look at the base-ten blocks in the image. Group A represents 200. Group B represents 20. Which statement is true?
questions.reportingCategory: Number Sense and Operations with Whole Numbers

questions.explanation: Analyze the relationship between 800 and 80. Since 80 is smaller than 800 by exactly one place value, look for the equation that shows division by 10 to reduce the value.
questions.text: Which equation correctly represents the relationship between the value of the digit 8 in 800 and the digit 8 in 80?
questions.reportingCategory: Number Sense and Operations with Whole Numbers

questions.explanation: Before comparing individual digits, you must count the total number of digits in each number. A number that extends to the hundred-thousands place is always greater than a number that only extends to the ten-thousands place.
options: She compared the ones place instead of the ten-thousands place.
She did not realize 98,999 has fewer digits than 102,001.
She should have added the digits together first.
She is actually correct; 98,999 is greater.
questions.text: Jamie compared the numbers 98,999 and 102,001. She wrote '98,999 > 102,001' because 9 is greater than 1. What was her error?
questions.reportingCategory: Number Sense and Operations with Whole Numbers

questions.explanation: This is 'ice wedging'. When water freezes, it expands, acting like a wedge that breaks the rock.
questions.text: Water seeps into a crack in a rock, freezes overnight, and expands, forcing the rock to split open. What caused this weathering?

questions.explanation: Seed -> Germination (sprouting) -> Growth -> Pollination (reproduction) -> Seed Dispersal.
questions.text: Identify the correct sequence for a flowering plant life cycle.

questions.explanation: The apparent movement of the stars across the sky is caused by Earth rotating (spinning) on its axis.
options: Because the stars are orbiting the Earth.
Because the Earth is rotating on its axis.
Because the Sun pushes them across the sky.
Because the Moon pulls them with gravity.
questions.text: Why do stars appear to move across the sky from east to west during the night?

questions.explanation: Layers of mud and sand are characteristic of sedimentary rocks (formed by sediment settling). Igneous rocks are formed from cooled melt and usually do not have these types of layers.
options: He is correct; igneous rocks always have layers.
Layers of mud and sand indicate the rock is sedimentary.
Igneous rocks are only found in water.
The rock is actually metamorphic because of the mud.
questions.text: A student claims that a rock he found is igneous because it has distinct layers of mud and sand. Why is his claim likely incorrect?

questions.explanation: Sedimentary rocks are formed from layers of sediment (sand, mud, pebbles) that are pressed and cemented together over time.
questions.text: A geologist finds a rock made of distinct layers of sand, mud, and pebbles cemented together. How should she classify this rock?
Type the word 'Beautiful' correctly.
questions.explanation: A helpful tip is: 'be-au-ti-ful'‚Äîit contains 'au' and ends with 'ful'.

questions.text: Type the word 'Calendar' correctly.
questions.explanation: Remember that 'calendar' has an 'a' after the 'l' and ends with 'dar'.

questions.text: Which word best completes the sentence: The player showed great ______ during the game.
Which word contains the base word act?
Which word has three syllables?
Your friend accidentally broke your pencil. What is the best way to react? ‚úèÔ∏èüíî
questions.explanation: Reacting calmly and asking for a solution is better than yelling or revenge.
options: Calmly accept their apology and ask to borrow one.

questions.text: Which is the best example of a specific goal? üéØ
questions.explanation: Specific goals state exactly what you will do and when, making them easier to achieve.
options: "I want to be better at reading."
"I will read for 20 minutes every day this week."

questions.text: You don't know the answer to a homework question. What is the BEST first step? ‚ùì
questions.explanation: Trying to solve it yourself first by rereading instructions helps build independence.
options: Give up and leave it blank.
Ask your parent to do it for you.
Reread the instructions and try again.

questions.text: What does it mean to be an 'active listener' when someone is talking to you? üëÇ
questions.explanation: Active listening involves looking at the speaker and focusing on their words, not doing other things.
options: Interrupting them with your own story.
Looking at your phone while they talk.
Thinking about what you will eat for dinner.

questions.text: You want to buy a toy. Store A sells it for $10. Store B sells it for $15. Which is the better deal? üè∑Ô∏è
questions.explanation: Buying the item for a lower price saves money.

questions.text: What is the primary reason we experience the cycle of day and night on Earth?
questions.explanation: Day and night are caused by Earth rotating (spinning) on its axis. One side faces the Sun (Day) while the other faces away (Night).
options: The Sun goes around the Earth.
The Earth rotates on its axis.
